required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Decision Support for Opioid Use Disorders in Medical Settings: Usability Testing in an EMR
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Decision Support for Opioid Use Disorders in Medical Settings: Pilot Usability Testing in an EMR

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this pilot study is to program an opioid use disorder (OUD) clinical decision support (CDS) tool for use in an electronic medical record (EMR) and obtain high primary care physician (PCP) usability and acceptability. The OUD-CDS is based on the NIDA-Blending Initiative white paper, "Clinical Decision Support for Opioid Use Disorders: Working Group Report," which itself is based on national evidence-based guidelines (American Society of Addiction Medicine (ASAM 2015), VA (VA 2015). As such, this pilot study aims to help PCPs achieve accepted standards of care in OUD treatment. The secondary objectives of this pilot study are to evaluate the usefulness of the tool by comparing OUD case-finding, medication-assisted therapy (MAT) and referral patterns pre- and post-CDS deployment for PCPs with and without CDS access.

primary_outcome.measure: Intervention PCP Confidence in Assessing and Treating OUD
primary_outcome.time_frame: This outcome measure was calculated at approximately month 10 of the pilot study
primary_outcome.description: # of intervention PCPs who report feeling "moderately" or "very" confident in assessing and treating OUD.

primary_outcome.measure: Intervention PCP Likeliness to Recommend Use of the OUD-CDS
primary_outcome.time_frame: This was calculated after PCP surveys were completed, approximately month 10
primary_outcome.description: # of PCPs with CDS access who rate the OUD-CDS >4 on a 5-point Likert scale of likeliness to recommend use of the tool to their colleagues. The scale ranges from 1-"not at all likely" to 5-"very likely," with higher values representing a higher likelihood of recommending the OUD-CDS to other colleagues.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare Pre- and Post-intervention Rates of OUD Diagnosis in High-risk Patients.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This was calculated at the end of the pilot study (month 8).
secondary_outcome.description: Calculate and compare the number of patients diagnosed with OUD pre- and post-intervention. This will be presented as rate of OUD diagnoses per patient year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare Pre- and Post-intervention Rates of Medication-assisted Therapy (MAT) Use.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This was calculated at the end of the pilot study (month 8).
secondary_outcome.description: Calculate and compare the rate of MAT use among patients with OUD pre- and post-intervention. This is presented as a pre/post ratio of MAT rx per patient year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare Post-intervention Referral Patterns Between Intervention and Control Groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This was calculated at the end of the pilot study (month 8).
secondary_outcome.description: Calculate and compare how often patients diagnosed with OUD are referred to specialty care or inpatient treatment post-intervention. Compare these rates between intervention and control groups.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Waivered Providers Receive the Opioid Wizard
arm_group.description: All providers who have a buprenorphine waiver will receive the OUD clinical decision support tool (Opioid Wizard).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Does not Receive the Opioid Wizard
arm_group.description: All non-buprenorphine waivered providers will be randomized to receive or not receive the Opioid Wizard. This arm of providers will continue to treat their patients as usual.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Non-Waivered Providers who receive Opioid Wizard
arm_group.description: All non-buprenorphine waivered providers will be randomized to receive or not receive the Opioid. This arm of providers will receive the OUD clinical decision support tool (Opioid Wizard).

intervention.description: The Opioid Wizard is an OUD clinical decision support tool for primary care providers.
intervention.arm_group_label: Non-Waivered Providers who receive Opioid Wizard
Waivered Providers Receive the Opioid Wizard

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be an MD, Doctor of Osteopathy, Nurse Practitioner or Physician's Assistant engaged in independent primary care of adults at HealthPartners or Park Nicollet
- Have at least schedule 3 DEA prescribing privileges
- Voluntarily provide written informed consent to participate in this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less than half-time clinical primary care responsibilities

group.title: Waivered Providers Received the Opioid Wizard
group.description: All Buprenorphine-Waivered providers received the OUD clinical decision support tool (Opioid Wizard). Opioid Wizard: The Opioid Wizard is an OUD clinical decision support tool for primary care providers.

group.title: Non-Waivered Providers Received The Opioid Wizard
group.description: Non-buprenorphine waivered providers were randomized to receive/not receive the Opioid Wizard. This arm represents providers who received the Opioid Wizard.

group.title: Non-Waivered Providers Who Did Not Receive the Opioid Wizard
group.description: Non-Buprenorphine waivered providers are randomized to receive/not receive the Opioid Wizard. This arm represents providers who did not receive the Opioid Wizard. These providers continued to treat their patients as usual.

group.title: Waivered Providers Received the Opioid Wizard
group.description: These providers received the OUD clinical decision support tool (Opioid Wizard). Opioid Wizard: The Opioid Wizard is an OUD clinical decision support tool for primary care providers.

group.title: Non-Waivered Providers Who Received the Opioid Wizard
group.description: Non-Buprenorphine waivered providers were randomized to receive/not receive the Opioid Wizard. This arm represents non-waivered providers who received the OUD clinical decision support tool (Opioid Wizard). Opioid Wizard: The Opioid Wizard is an OUD clinical decision support tool for primary care providers.

group.title: Non-Waivered Providers Who do Not Receive the Opioid Wizard
group.description: These are non-buprenorphine waivered providers continued to treat their patients as usual.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Intervention PCP Confidence in Assessing and Treating OUD
outcome.description: # of intervention PCPs who report feeling "moderately" or "very" confident in assessing and treating OUD.
outcome.time_frame: This outcome measure was calculated at approximately month 10 of the pilot study
outcome.population: This outcome was to help show proof of the OUD-CDS concept using responses from intervention PCPs. One intervention provider stopped working for the organization during the intervention. Two additional intervention providers in the "Non-Waivered providers who received the Opioid Wizard" arm did not complete follow-up surveys.

group.title: Waivered Providers Received the Opioid Wizard
group.description: All Buprenorphine-Waivered providers received the OUD clinical decision support tool (Opioid Wizard). Opioid Wizard: The Opioid Wizard is an OUD clinical decision support tool for primary care providers.

group.title: Non-Waivered Providers Who Received the Opioid Wizard
group.description: Non-Buprenorphine waivered providers were randomized to receive/not receive the Opioid Wizard. This arm represents providers who received the Opioid Wizard.

measure.title: Intervention PCP Confidence in Assessing and Treating OUD
measure.description: # of intervention PCPs who report feeling "moderately" or "very" confident in assessing and treating OUD.
measure.population: This outcome was to help show proof of the OUD-CDS concept using responses from intervention PCPs. One intervention provider stopped working for the organization during the intervention. Two additional intervention providers in the "Non-Waivered providers who received the Opioid Wizard" arm did not complete follow-up surveys.

outcome.title: Intervention PCP Likeliness to Recommend Use of the OUD-CDS
outcome.description: # of PCPs with CDS access who rate the OUD-CDS >4 on a 5-point Likert scale of likeliness to recommend use of the tool to their colleagues. The scale ranges from 1-"not at all likely" to 5-"very likely," with higher values representing a higher likelihood of recommending the OUD-CDS to other colleagues.
outcome.time_frame: This was calculated after PCP surveys were completed, approximately month 10
outcome.population: One non-waivered intervention provider stopped working for the organization and two additional non-waivered intervention providers did not complete the follow-up survey.

reported_events.time_frame: These data were collected during the entire active intervention period, from 6/6/2018-12/6/2018

group.title: Waivered Providers Who Received the Opioid Wizard
group.description: These providers received the OUD clinical decision support tool (Opioid Wizard). Opioid Wizard: The Opioid Wizard is an OUD clinical decision support tool for primary care providers.

group.title: Non-Waivered Providers Who Received the Opioid Wizard
group.description: Non-waivered providers were randomized to receive/not receive the Opioid Wizard. This arm represents the providers who received access to the opioid wizard.

group.title: Non-Waivered Providers Who Did Not Receive the Opioid Wizard
group.description: Non-waivered providers were randomized to receive/not receive the Opioid Wizard. This arm represents the providers who did not receive access to the opioid wizard.These providers continued to treat their patients as usual.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
